Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, parking lot, pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include various types of living things, like trees, bushes, grasses, or flowering plants in each habitat drawing.
The student can illustrate different animals such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams in the appropriate habitats.
The student can compare and show diversity by drawing different plants and animals found in each type of habitat.
The student can use their drawing to illustrate patterns of plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
